statement.tex: \text{Find the domain of the function} \\ \qquad f(x) = \dfrac{x^2+2x+1}{x^2-8x+12}

step.context: f(x) = \dfrac{x^2+2x+1}{x^2-8x+12} = \dfrac{(x+1)^2}{(x + A)\cdot (x+B)}\\ \text{What are the values of A and B?}
\text{Given }f(x) = \dfrac{(x+1)^2}{(x-2)\cdot (x-6)},\text{ what would}\\ \text{be the domain of f(x)?}
step.reason: \text{If f(x) is not defined for some x, then that}\\ \text{x cannot be in the domain.} \\ \text{And note that f(x) is not defined for }x = 2,6. \\ \text{But it is defined for every other x. Hence, }\\ \qquad \textbf{Domain = }\mathbb{R} - \lbrace 2,6 \rbrace
